conversations.value: Oh wow, look at that technique, Rach! The way he's positioned his body and the angle of his serve - it's just textbook perfect!
I know! And look at the focus in his eyes. It's like the world stands still for that one perfect serve. I have to say, I am definitely... 'served' by that enthusiasm.
It's all about biomechanics, you know? That specific motion combined with the perfect toss can create the ideal serve speed. It's fascinating!
Biomechanics? Sure, honey. I was just appreciating the... 'aesthetics' of the game.

Okay, okay, aesthetics are important too, I mean, who doesn't like watching something beautiful in motion? But the physical prowess, the years of training that must've gone into-- Wait, are they using new rackets? They look aerodynamically advanced!
You would notice the rackets, Ross. I, on the other hand, am noticing his impressive... dedication to the sport, obviously.
Right, dedication! You know, it reminds me of the time I tried to teach Ben and Emma to play, um, you know, just a simple forehand swing.
My God, that was hilarious. You were more into it than they were! I think at one point you were actually playing against yourself.
Well, somebody had to keep the rally going. Next time we should all play doubles. You and me, versus Ben and Emma, or, or, maybe Joey and Chandler!

Sure, as long as you promise not to use the word 'biomechanics' on the court, or give me that long speech on the evolutionary significance of cooperative team sports... which I know you're about to start any minute now.
You know me too well. But I can't promise anything when tennis and evolutionary theory collide in a conversation.
Maybe stick to the 'collision' on the tennis court, Dr. Geller. And perhaps, let's agree to keep score in a way that doesn't involve paleontological ages, okay?
That, Rachel, is completely reasonable. But if we're talking ages, just for the record, I think we make a great 'Jurassic' team.
Ross, as long as you're not calling me a dinosaur, I'll take that as a compliment. Let's just enjoy the game. And maybe later, we can 'serve' up something a little less, uh, 'prehistoric' for dinner?
It's a date. Pizza from that new place you love?
Yes, with extra cheese - no anchovies! I just love how 'evolved' your taste in food has become, Ross.
All for you, Rach. All for you.
Look at this, Rach. Doesn't this remind you of Monica's obsessive Thanksgiving prep?
Absolutely! The way she meticulously arranges everything on the table and freaks out if someone touches a carrot stick before dinner.
And remember the time I tried to help and ended up dropping that bowl of mashed potatoes? Monica almost banned me from the kitchen forever!
Yes, how could I forget? You were on potato peeling duty for the next three Thanksgivings as punishment.
I know! But hey, see how carefully they're preparing the food here? It's all about the love and attention to detail. It's genuinely touching.
It is. It makes me think about the time we all pitched in to cook dinner together. As chaotic as it was, those were some good times.
They were the best, weren't they? I mean, despite the occasional food fight and Chandler's 'special' culinary contributions.
Ha, yeah! Chandler and his 'special' cranberry sauce from a can. It's just not Thanksgiving without it.
And look, Rach, doesn’t it seem like everyone comes together around food, no matter where you are in the world? It's kind of a universal language.
It really is. I love that about food – it brings people closer and creates some of the best memories. Okay, now you're making me all sentimental.
Aww, come here. You know, we should host a little dinner again soon, just for old times' sake.
Only if you promise not to drop anything this time. And Ross, please, let's keep the 'We were on a break' apron in the closet!
You've got yourself a deal! But, Rach... we were—
If you finish that sentence, Geller, you're on dish duty for a year!
Okay, okay! I'm zipping it. Now, how about we plan the menu together? Maybe you could make that trifle again...
Oh no, you don't. We're sticking to recipes that do not involve beef and peas in dessert, thank you very much.
Fair enough. But hey, it's an unforgettable signature dish!
Ross, honey, some things are better left un-remembered.
Look Rach, there's a guy playing tennis on TV. Do you see the graceful way he's swinging that racket? It's like he's dancing with the air... or fighting it.
Yeah, he does look pretty intense. Tennis players have to be really focused, Phoebe. It's not easy hitting a ball going a million miles an hour.

I bet he wouldn't stand a chance against my wicked serve. You know, back in the day, I had quite the unorthodox technique. It involved a lot of meditation and, occasionally, summoning the spirit of Billie Jean King.
I would've paid good money to see that! Were you like, doing yoga poses while serving?
Not exactly, but there was a lot of deep breathing and sometimes I’d give the ball a little pep talk before launching it across the cosmic plane, or, you know, the net.
Phoebe, you should've been a tennis instructor! Imagine all those posh people learning the Buffay method. "First, you align your chakras, then you serve."
Totally! I would revolutionize the tennis world. But why stop there? I could introduce the Phoebe Buffay approach to all sorts of sports—like synchronized swimming with actual mermaids!
My gosh, could you imagine? I'm pretty sure you just found a new career path. But for now, this guy... his form is incredible. I wonder how long he's been playing.
Probably since he was a tiny embryo with a tiny racket, dreaming of grand slams and… what’s another tennis thing? Oh, aces!
Yeah, and imagine all the practice and all the matches leading up to this moment. Tennis is like life, you know? You just keep swinging, hoping you don't get hit in the face with a ball.
That's deep, Rach. And if life is like tennis, I guess that makes love the doubles match. Still figuring out who’s in charge of the backhand.
Now that’s a metaphor I can get behind. Speaking of love, do you think this player has a Mrs. Tennis Player waiting for him at home?
If he does, I hope she’s prepared for a lot of laundry. Because those sweaty wristbands have to go somewhere, and it’s not going to be the magical laundry basket that cleans itself.
I could use one of those magic baskets. Anyway, he's definitely got that champion vibe going on, doesn't he?
Absolutely. Energy like that... he has to be a winner. And if not, the universe is clearly out of balance.
Well, I’m gonna grab some snacks while we watch Mr. Universe Balance over here hopefully win his match. You want anything, Pheebs?
Do you have any of those organic kale chips left? They’d go great with spiritual tennis spectating.
Kale chips it is. So healthy, we are.
Look at that little boat, Rach! It reminds me of the one in my song, "The Tiny Rowboat." Except, you know, it's not rowing and it's not tiny.
Oh my god, Phoebe, that's a cute boat! It kind of makes you want to just sail away from all your problems, doesn't it?
Totally! Except for sea monsters... they're a big problem in the water. You never forget your first kraken.
Phoebe, I'm pretty sure there are no krakens in that water. Besides, look how calm it is. It's beautiful.
True, it is serene... like a big, wet, Zen garden. I bet that boat has seen things, Rach. Imagine the stories it could tell!
Yeah! Like, maybe it was once part of a dramatic getaway or a romantic cruise around the world. The possibilities are endless!
Or maybe it's an undercover spy boat, named Special Agent Bob. It's wearing a disguise so the enemy vessels don't recognize it. "Oh no, I’m just a regular boat, nothing to see here."
Phoebe, you have the wildest imagination. But that's what makes watching stuff with you so much fun.
Awww, thank you, Rach. You know, we should rent a boat sometime and make our own stories. We can be pirates, but the good kind, like Robin Hood on water.
I love that idea! We can even search for lost treasure... or at least drop by that little island for a picnic. Y'know, if it's not already claimed by the mermaids or something.
That's the spirit! Just as long as there's no plank-walking. I haven't had good experiences with planks... or walking.
It’s a deal then!  No planks, just snacks, sun, and the sea. And definitely no krakens, promise.
Perfection! And I'll bring my guitar. We'll serenade the sea creatures. Maybe we'll even make friends with a dolphin or two!
Oh, I would love that! And just imagine the suntan lines we'd get to show off at Central Perk!
Yes! We'd get all bronzy and then I could sing "Smelly Cat" with a pirate twist! "Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, what arrrr they feeding you?"
Phoebe, never change.  You make even watching a boat an adventure.
Look at this, Rach. Do you remember when we took the subway to go to that museum exhibit and we ended up sitting right next to an ad for that absurd sci-fi movie?
Ugh, yes! How could I forget? It was the one with the alien that looked like a giant lobster. I mean, it's no wonder that people around us moved to the next car.
And, you know, seeing ads like this one kind of takes me back to those bizarre ads from the 90s. You know, this one here would make quite the fossil.

Totally, Ross. Although, 'kills em stone dead' isn't quite the catchy slogan I'd go for in a fashion ad. And, can we talk about all that empty space on the bench? That's prime people-watching territory on a New York subway!

You're right. In a weird way, it's a metaphor for the urban isolation of the city—so many people close by, yet everyone's in their own world. Although I can't help but wonder about the entomological accuracy of that cartoon bug.
Ross, only you would look at an ad and critique the bug's scientific accuracy. By the way, are they allowed to claim that something "kills em stone dead"? Isn't that a little... extreme?
Hahaha, they got away with a lot more in advertising back then. It’s interesting though, don't you think that—
That it looks like they're waiting for a train to someplace way more glamorous than wherever that bug is headed? Yeah, I do, Ross. And look at that guy’s sandals, definitely not subway-friendly.

Good point. But imagine the history these walls have seen. This ad might just be a small part of someone’s story, like someone remembering sitting next to future parents or the beginning of a great friendship.
It’s kind of romantic when you put it that way, Ross. You always have a knack for finding the magic in everyday stuff.
Well, that's the paleontologist in me—always digging for a deeper meaning. And doing it with you, Rach, that's the best part.
Aww, that's sweet, Ross. Just promise me that the next time we're on the subway together, no entomology talk, ok? More people-watching and definitely more hand-holding.
It's a deal, no bug talk. Just us, people-watching and hand-holding on our urban safari. And maybe, just maybe, avoiding sitting next to the guy with questionable fashion choices.
That's my paleontologist.
Could that BE any more trains in one place? I mean, we could practically start our own transportation monopoly.
Oh my god, Chandler, are you thinking about trading your office for a conductor's hat? 'Cause I'm not gonna lie, I could totally see you in those cute little overalls.
You mean trade in my soul-crushing job for the whimsical life of riding the rails? Tempting, Rach, but I'm pretty sure the overalls would clash with my sarcasm.
Just think of all the places you could go. There's something romantic about it, don't you think? Like maybe you could find a new place to hate Thanksgiving.
Well, as long as the train has a "No Janice" car, I'm all aboard! And in every new city, I could get off and celebrate Unthanksgiving!
Unthanksgiving? That is so you. But you'd have to bring Monica. She could cook something that actually stays within the theme.
Under one condition — there will be no traditional English trifle with beef. We still have nightmares about yours, remember?
Please, like you guys didn't love my 'I don't have all the right ingredients' masterpiece. It was a culinary... surprise.
A surprise that could have ignited a new World War, only it would be fought with spoons and regret.
Well, you know me, just trying to keep life interesting. Maybe I should have gone into the food car industry.
On that note, I'd rather stick to statistically analyzing the probability of who would hurl first. Spoiler: it's Joey, it's always Joey.
Okay, well, if you two decide to ditch the 'boring jobs' and become train-hoppers, I call dibs on designing the uniforms. Think 'vintage chic' meets 'modern-day hobo.'
And I'll be there throwing sarcastic comments like smoke signals! Wait, are you saying Joey and I could be like a modern Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid?
Ah-ha! Well, if you're Butch Cassidy, I guess that makes Monica the Sundance Kid, because let's face it, she's the one who calls the shots.
True, true. But when it comes to train robberies, I'll leave that to her competitive streak. She can steal the spotlight and I, the brave knight, will bring Joey our stolen sandwiches.
Chandler, could you BE any more of a hero? Just make sure those sandwiches aren't filled with any 'Rachel Green Special Beef Trifle', okay?
The world isn't ready for such bold flavors, Rachel. But perhaps I can derail the conversation to a safer topic: How long do you think we'd last before Monica accuses us of being love-train hobos?
Knowing Monica? About as long as it takes for Joey to finish those sandwiches... so, five seconds max.

Look at that, Rach! It's almost like the universe is telling that plane to just lift off and chase its dreams. You know, like when a caterpillar becomes a butterfly, or when I realized I could sing about both smelly cats and sticky shoes.

Pheebs, that's so you to think about a plane chasing dreams. But yeah, it is pretty amazing how something that big just... takes off into the sky. You know, it kind of reminds me of when I left Barry at the altar. Terrifying, but totally exhilarating!

I know, right? And just like your life, that plane doesn't know where it's gonna land. But the adventure is all in the flying part. Unless of course, it flies into a vortex where time doesn't exist. Then, I mean, who knows?

A vortex, Phoebe? God, I miss your out-there theories. But speaking of landing, do you think that if I were on that plane, I'd be visiting a fashion capital? Oh, imagine the shopping, the runway shows, the... shoes!
Totally! Maybe it's going to Milan, and you'd be in your element. But knowing my luck, I’d end up sitting next to someone with a pet snake who wants to talk about his reptilian auras.
Ugh, snakes on a plane? That's a definite no for me. I'll stick to my snakeskin print, thank you very much. Can you imagine me trying to sleep next to that?
Ha! Well, if you ever do, you just call me, and I'll sing "Smelly Cat" through the phone to scare away any slithery seatmates. And I'll do it with passion, because that's what friends are for!

God, I can't tell you how much I'd appreciate that. And talking about friends... can you imagine us all on a plane together? Monica would be wiping down everything with disinfectant, Joey would be flirting with the flight attendants...

And Ross would be explaining the physics of flight to everyone, while Chandler makes jokes about the in-flight peanuts! Oh, and you know, poor Joey would just be there wondering if the plane can carry all his sandwiches.
Absolutely! And I would be right there with him, worrying about the in-flight fashion. Do you think they have a closet for your coats? Because I do not want mine just stuffed in an overhead bin.
Rach, you could make a burlap sack work as high fashion. Also, do planes have burlap sacks? Because that's environmentally friendly, and I support that!

You're too sweet, Pheebs. But okay, no more plane talk. I'm starting to actually want to go somewhere, and you know I can't do that right now. Let's go get some coffee at Central Perk, maybe Gunther will let me work the espresso machine again for old times' sake?

Yes! And I’ll play a couple of songs. Hey, maybe I could write a song about us watching this plane... "Flying High with Friends". I swear, it’ll be a hit, or at least it'll make Gunther smile more. Lead the way, Green machine!
Look at that, Rach! The intensity on that hitter's face, it's like he's channeling everything I feel during a cooking competition!
I swear, Mon, you could find a way to relate baseball to a quiche. But you're right, he does look pretty intense.
You know what this reminds me of? Playing softball in the park with the guys. Remember when Joey pretended to run home and literally slid into a family's picnic?
Yes! And how could I forget the time you organized the team and had us practice like it was the World Series? You were so furious when we lost because Phoebe got distracted by a dog in the outfield.
I still stand by my decision; we needed discipline! Plus, hello, we were not losing to Chandler's office team again. I mean, seriously, who gets distracted by puppies when there are fly balls?!
Phoebe does. And, oddly enough, it kind of worked out. She met that guy who was walking the dog. What was his name again?
Mike. It turned out to be the best distraction ever. Okay, but back to the game, imagine what it must feel like to be that batter. The crowd, the anticipation—pure adrenaline!
And what about the catcher? I mean, look at him, ready in position. It's just like you with a new recipe—focused, ready to take on whatever comes your way.
Please. That catcher wishes he had my hand-eye coordination. All those finely chopped vegetables? That's precision.
Alright, Mon, but still, I think it's nice we've got these little traditions, you know? Watching the game, hanging with friends. It's like our very own version of baseball.
Speaking of traditions, I think a night like this calls for some of my classic homemade snacks. How about those jalapeno poppers you love?
Now you're talking! Make enough for Joey, and you're officially the MVP of game night.
Whoa, Rach, check this out! You think that plane flies to sandwich island? 'Cause I could go for a sandwich right about now!
Oh my God, Joey, not everything is about food! But look at that view, it's beautiful. I bet you could take some amazing fashion shots out there... if you know, there was a fashion island next door.
Fashion Island? There’s an island for everything! If that's true, we gotta find the one with pizza. How you doin', Pizza Island?
Joey, you're ridiculous. And you know, if there was a Pizza Island, you would try to be its president.
President Tribbiani... I like the sound of that. But my first order of business would be to get one of those seaplanes. 'Cause, you know, it's like a boat and a plane. Best of both worlds!
Yeah, knowing you, you'd probably try to fish for your own dinner out of the plane. Actually... that's not the worst idea.
Hey, I'm all about the surf and turf! But wait, there's ducks there too. Maybe I can negotiate a trade. "I’ll give you some flying tips if you hook me up with some fish!"
Just make sure they're not like the ducks from Central Park. Remember what happened last time you tried to feed them?
Yeah, never get between a duck and its food. That's a lesson learned. But hey, Rache, if I book us two tickets to... wherever this amazing place is, would you come with me?
You know what, Joey? If you're flying, I might just have to say yes. It could be like... our little adventure. As long as we don’t actually eat any ducks.
Deal! And Rachel, we wouldn't eat the ducks... because Joey doesn’t share food!
Oh Joey, never change.
Look at this, Rach. They're like us but in mirror world! Do you think they have their own Central Perk somewhere?
Phoebe, you are so random! I mean, it's just two women in a restroom. You know, it kind of reminds me of the time you and I got locked in that bathroom at that party.
Right? That was a hoot. We should've had someone take our picture like this. You know, for the memories. Now we only have our minds to remember, which... let’s face it, isn’t always reliable.
Come on, Pheebs. We made some guy slide our pizzas under the door! If I hadn't been so embarrassed, I would have died laughing. Especially when you started singing 'Smelly Cat.'

Yeah, 'Smelly Cat' has gotten me through a lot of tough times. Hey, do you think the lady on the left is thinking deep, existential thoughts, or is she just wondering where to eat later? 'Cause her face is totally my 'what do I want for lunch?' face.
Knowing you, she's probably thinking about the meaning of life. But honestly, I'm just intrigued by the fact that only one of them is using the mirror. What do you think the other one is looking at?
Maybe she's a ghost! And she doesn't have a reflection! Imagine the kind of hauntings you could do in a restroom.
Phoebe! Please tell me you are not going to start checking every bathroom mirror for ghosts now. And no, I am not letting you bring sage into my bathroom to clear spirits.

Don't worry, I'll protect you from the bathroom ghosts, Rach. Unless they're friendly, like Casper – then we could have a new ghost friend! But honestly, what do you think about this as an art piece? We could hang it in the living room – give the place a little bit of edge, a conversation starter!

Sweetie, that's very...you, but let's just stick to Pottery Barn for home decor, okay? And anyway, you know Ross would just talk everyone's ears off about the 'fascinating implications of reflective surfaces in modern society.'
Ha! Classic Ross. It's just like the time he tried to teach us about the sedimentary layers in Monica's lasagna. But you know, if these women were us, what do you think they're talking about?
Probably about a very weird blonde lady and a fashion-obsessed brunette staring at them talking about their lives. Now let's get going before someone tries to deliver us pizza in this restroom!

Okay, so let me get this straight, we've got a stop sign with... just take a wild guess here... "Stop" written on it, in what appears to be the world's least stoppable location! Could this BE any more ironic?
I know, right? That hill is so steep, if you actually stopped, you'd probably just start rolling backwards. It's like a metaphor for my early twenties, you know, before I figured out laundry.

Ah yes, the mysterious art of separating the whites from the, well, everything else. And speaking of going backwards, could that car parked on the hill be any more precariously positioned? It's like the car's whispering, "Please, let gravity take the wheel".
Totally, it's kind of like how I felt when I first started working at Central Perk. "Please, let someone else make the coffee."
Speaking of coffee, don't you think the driver of that car probably needs one after navigating this urban roller coaster? Maybe even a double shot to calm the nerves.

Definitely. But they'd have to get to Central Perk without, you know, accidentally turning their car into a runaway pinball. And look at all those wires. Remember the time Phoebe thought she’d spotted a "spy satellite" outside our window, but it was just a tangle of phone lines?
Oh my god, yes. Our very own conspiracy theorist. Also, is it just me, or does that stop sign have a certain dystopian dictator vibe? "Thou shalt not pass... or even consider it."
You're so right! It's got this "Big Brother is watching your brakes" feel. Chandler, you should put a warning sign up in your office, like "Stop: Do not enter with bad jokes." It's perfect for you!
A stop sign in my office would actually be useful. Like, "Stop: Consider if you really want to hear the story about my vestigial tail before you come any closer." It would save time.
And probably friendships too. But honestly, with traffic like that, it's a wonder people get anywhere on time. Makes New York traffic seem like a breeze.
New York traffic, a breeze? Rachel, the only breeze in New York traffic comes from the collective sighs of thousands of exasperated drivers.
Whoa, Rach, check this out! Is this like, the biggest garage sale for skis, or what?
Joey, those are not for sale! That's a ski resort. You can tell by all the snow and the flags. Oh, and those cozy looking tents!
Right, right, the... snow tents. So, uh, no chance of picking up a cheap pair of skis, huh?
Nope, sorry, sweetie. But I have to say, that yellow jacket in the middle really pops against the snow, don't you think?
Rachel Green, always the fashion eye. But yeah, I can't help but think that if I wore that jacket, I'd look like a giant banana sliding down the hill.
That, I would pay to see. You on skis would be like Bambi on ice. Remember when Ross tried to teach us ice skating that one time?
How could I forget? I spent more time on my butt than on my feet. But hey, I bet these ski guys probably started the same way, right?
Absolutely, Joey. Everyone starts somewhere. And speaking of starting, have you ever tried skiing?

Me? Nah, the closest I've got to skiing is sitting on the couch with my hot cocoa watching the winter Olympics. There was that one time, though, when I auditioned for a skiing accident victim on a soap opera.
A skiing accident victim? Joey, that’s not even close to actual skiing.
Hey, I had to lay there with a fake cast on my leg. It takes real talent to look that hurt.
Oh, Joey, only you could turn lying still into an art form. You should stick to sandwich eating contests; it's much safer.
Now that's something I can win a gold medal in! Speaking of which, are you thinking what I’m thinking?
If it involves getting sandwiches, then yes, Joey, I am definitely thinking what you’re thinking.
That's my girl! Alright, let's grab some grub and watch people do the skiing thing while we're at it. How you doin’ by the way?
Oh boy, Joey, don’t start with "How you doin'" on me, we're just going to have sandwiches, okay?
Can't blame a guy for trying, right? Alright, Rachel Green, lead the way!
Look at this, Rach! It's a horse-drawn railway carriage. Can you believe people actually used to travel this way?
I know, right? Now, was this before or after they thought the Earth was flat?
Very funny. But seriously, historical transportation is fascinating. It's like, this was the hybrid vehicle of its time!
A hybrid, really? Because to me, it just looks like a big old wooden box on wheels with a horse stuck to it.

Yes, but you see— the horse represents a natural power source, much like today's electric cars, juxtaposed with the mechanical innovation of railway travel. It's like an early attempt at combining the old with the new!
Wow, Ross. Leave it to you to turn a picture of a horse and a cart into a science lesson.
Come on. It's not just a horse and cart, it's a glimpse into an era of transformational change in society's mobility. I mean, just imagine the stories this carriage could tell if it could talk.
If that carriage could talk, I'd ask it for fashion tips from the 1800s. Can you imagine the outfits people wore back then?
True, corsets and top hats were quite the trend. But more importantly, it symbolizes human innovation and progress. It's incredible to think how much we've advanced since then.
And let's not forget about the horse. I mean, he's the real MVP here, pulling all that weight. By the way, do you think he had a name?
Hmm, if I had to guess, something dignified and strong, like... Maximus or Hercules.
Hercules? Ross, you are such a dork. But I love it. It probably was something cute, like Mr. Clip-Clop.
Mr. Clip-Clop, really?
Yes, and I bet Mr. Clip-Clop here was the best-dressed horse in all of Mundoor... wherever this is.
Look at this guy. He's really into that giant, mutant cookie jar. Or at least, I think it's a cookie jar—do you see it?
Ugh, I know, right? But Phoebe, that's not a cookie jar, it's a drum! And it looks like he's just about to hit it. Maybe he's in a band or something?

Ohh, a drummer! That's kind of sexy, right? You know, there was a time I dated a drummer. But then I realized I was just attracted to his drum. It's nothing compared to my smelly cat, though. Musical talent is so magnetic.
Absolutely, drummers are cool! But remember that time Ross played the bagpipes? I swear I couldn't stop giggling. I mean, was he serious?
Yeah, Ross and his "music." It's like, Earth to Ross, you know? And his face right now, he looks so serious. Kind of like how Ross looks when he's trying to explain the Paleozoic era to us.
Tell me about it. But, at least this guy's got style. I mean, check out that shirt with the dragon. That’s so not Ross.
Totally! It screams, "I'm a badass drummer with a dragon on my chest." It could totally be the lead singer of "Phoebe and the Puffay Dragons."
Phoebe, you crack me up! Maybe you can write a song about him? Call it, "Drummer with the Dragon Tattoo"?
That's good. You're my muse, Rach! I think it'll be a hit, right after "Smelly Cat."
Well, with your talent, I wouldn't be surprised. Just remember me when you're all famous and touring the world, okay?
Rach, you'll always be my backup singer. Just do me a favor and don't wear anything too "shiny" on stage. We don't want you to distract from the dragon vibe.
Phoebe, trust me, there is no dress code that could make me go on stage and sing. Remember the copier incident at work? Yeah, stage fright does not even begin to cover it.
Right, well, if you change your mind, the offer stands. Regina Phalange and the Backup Rach has a certain ring to it, don't you think?
How could I pass up a chance to be a part of that legendary duo? Keep dreaming big, Pheebs!
Okay, so you know how I love organizing, right? Look at this, Rach. What do you see in this image?
Mon, are you trying to give me a heart attack? That suitcase is a complete mess! It's like a jumbled sale rack at Bloomingdale's during clearance!

Right? It's driving me crazy just looking at it! And look at the surrounding floor; there's stuff scattered everywhere. Not just clothes, but like, plastic bags and everything! Whoever packed this must be the opposite of 'Monica clean'.
Oh yeah, it’s definitely not 'Monica clean'. But you know, it kind of reminds me of the time when I first moved in. Remember my luggage? It wasn’t quite this bad... Was it?

Your suitcase had structure, Rachel. I mean, this is just... it's chaos! If I got my hands on it, I would roll every piece of clothing, fit them into perfect little rows – it’d be the most satisfying thing.
Sweetie, you'd reorganize a department store if they let you. But honestly, that suitcase does look like someone packed it in a hurry. Probably realized their flight leaves in two hours.
Two hours? If that were me, I'd start packing two weeks in advance! I’d have itineraries printed out, a place for everything... It's just so efficient.
Yes, and we'd all have to hear about the itinerary every day up to the flight. Sometimes, spontaneity can be fun, Mon.

Fun? You call this fun? I call it an invitation for wrinkles and misplaced underwear. Imagine reaching your destination and finding out you forgot your socks because you were too busy being... spontaneous.
Okay, okay, you have a point with the socks. And yes, wrinkles are a nightmare – but some of my best adventures started with a last-minute packed bag and a crazy dash to the airport.
Adventures, messes... sometimes I think it's a miracle we live so harmoniously together given how different we are about these things.
Come on, it is our differences that make things work. I bring a little chaos, you bring an obsessive amount of order, and somehow, it balances out.
I suppose you're right. But no amount of chaos will ever make me not want to repack that suitcase. It’s begging for some Monica magic.
I'll tell you what, why don't we find that unlucky packer and offer your packing services? You'll get to organize, and I'll make sure they don't miss their flight.
You’re on. It’ll be like a good deed and stress relief all in one. But if we can't find them, I'm going to organize your closet as a backup plan.
Monica, there's no need for threats! And honestly, I'd like to see you try. It might just be more challenging than that suitcase!
Hey Rach, check this out! Is it just me, or does that table look like it's getting ready to make a run for it?
Oh my God, Joey, it does! It's like the chairs are standing guard while the table tries to sneak away in, uh, high heels?
High heels! That's gold! Maybe it's going on a date, you know, trying to look all fancy.
Definitely a first date. I mean, look at the effort with those shoes. That table is really trying to impress someone.
Ha! Yeah! And with those high heels, it'd probably end up ordering the most expensive item on the menu, right?
Joey, it's a table. It doesn't eat.
Right! But if it did, you bet it would be like, "Oh, I'll have the lobster. And keep the champagne coming!"
It kinda reminds me of my first week in the city, all dressed up and nowhere to go. You remember, when I was all fancy and clueless?
Aw, Rach, you were never clueless. Okay, maybe a little. But hey, now you're one of the most fashionable people I know. Who else could make a table in high heels look stylish?
Flattery will get you nowhere, Tribbiani. But seriously, who puts high heels on a table? That's just... it's so impractical!
You know, if my agent saw this, he’d probably try to cast it in some avant-garde play. It's symbolic, like the struggle of inanimate objects to be more human or something.
Please. The only struggle here is trying to figure out who thought this was a good idea. And the bigger question is, where on earth do you find high heels for a table?
Wait a minute. I got it! This is a moo point.
Joey, it's 'moot'. And what do you mean?
It's like a cow's opinion, you know? It doesn't matter. Because whether the table wants to strut in heels or not, it's still gonna be a table.
Oh, Joey. Never change.
How you doin'?
No, you're not pulling your catchphrase on a table, Joey Tribbiani!
I couldn't resist! Alright, I'm thinking this table deserves a name. Something classy, like... Veronica.
Veronica? Oh, but she does look like a Veronica. Maybe she's waiting for her date, Tony the coat rack.
Tony the coat rack, perfect! And he's running late because he couldn't decide which hat to wear.
But little does Veronica know, Tony's just around the corner, planning to surprise her with a beautiful bouquet of... I don't know, mini lampshades?
Ha! Rach, you're killin' me! I think we got ourselves the next hit sitcom here - "The Furniture Love Story."
We better get writing then. I mean, who needs Hollywood when you've got a café sidewalk and a very ambitious table?
With the way my auditions are going, a café sidewalk might be my next big break!
Could this signpost BE any more confusing? I mean, which way to the commitment ceremony—do you take a sharp left or just continue straight... away from it?
Oh my God, Chandler, are you still on about your commitment issues? Besides, it's just a signpost, not a metaphor for your life.
I'm sorry, I can't hear you over the sound of all those directions not helping anyone find anything. It's like it's saying, "Welcome to Nowheresville, population: us."
Please, you love it; it's just like your sense of direction—completely all over the place.
Hey! For your information, I have a very good sense of direction... when Google Maps is whispering in my ear.
You know, if we were actually standing there, you'd probably be the guy who'd walk into a church thinking it was a coffee shop.
And you'd be right behind me, thinking the holy water was some kind of new age skin product.
Okay, that's fair. But seriously, imagine trying to meet someone here. They're like, "I'm by the signpost," and you're just endlessly circling around it.
Yeah, "Meet me by the signpost" is basically "Friends" code for "let's not see each other ever again." Could I BE walking in circles any longer?
Well, if Joey were here, he'd say it's just like a giant game of 'Spin the Bottle', minus the bottle... or the fun.
Ah, good old 'Spin the Bottle'... You know, I'd actually prefer getting dizzy from that than trying to figure out this thing.
Wow, Chandler Bing, wishing for a game that involves chance and unpredictability? Who are you and what have you done with the real Chandler?
I'm the new, adventurous Chandler, coming to you live from the crossroads of confusion and poor urban planning.
You know what, Chandler? You might be on to something. We should take this signpost and put it in your office. It's the perfect representation of your career path.
Ouch! That's... actually very accurate. Could my job BE any less directional?
Oh my God, Rach, look at this kitchen! It's... It's so rustic and charming, don't you think?
Yeah, it definitely has that cozy "undone" look. Not your usual "Monica clean", but cute for a change, I guess.
I mean, look at those hanging pots! Imagine all the delicious meals I could cook in those babies. Not to mention how convenient it is to have everything just hanging there within reach.
Convenient, sure. But can we talk about that adorable little plant sitting there? I swear, if you added a teeny tiny hat to it, it would be the cutest thing ever.
You and your hats, Rach. But actually, that's a healthy looking plant right there. I approve. And what about that fruit bowl on the table? That splash of color is just... it's so inviting!
It's like the kitchen's saying, "Hey, come eat some fruit and be healthy." It would never fly at my place. Emma would just turn that bowl over in a second.
Ha! Yeah, I can almost hear Jack and Erica causing a fruit avalanche. But seriously, this is giving me ideas for the new house. Chandler's gonna have to brace himself for a kitchen makeover.
God, brace yourself, Bing! Monica's got that "I'm always the hostess" look in her eyes. You're about to be neck-deep in paint swatches and fabric samples.
What can I say, I know what I like! And speaking of makeovers, doesn't that quilt kind of remind you of something Phoebe would craft?
Absolutely. It screams Phoebe. Eclectic, vibrant, possibly harboring a few hidden "smelly cat" lyrics within its threads.
Okay, but seriously, we need to have a little crafting day soon. Maybe even get Joey to knit something. Remember when he accidentally made that one giant sock?
How could I forget? He wore it like a badge of honor. And I'm in for crafting day! But, Monica, promise me, if we go for this look, we're not installing a sink that's the size of a bathtub, okay?
Deal. But only if you promise to let me teach you how to properly organize a pantry this time. Remember the "can incident" of '98?
Don't remind me! I still have nightmares of tomato sauce. Fine, it's a deal. But I'm picking the radio station while we work.
Seven! Seven! Seven! stations it is then! Now, let's grab a coffee and plan this out. We're gonna rock this rustic chic, Rachel Green style.
That's the spirit, Mon! Just don't get too crazy with the ladles and spatulas. I'm still finding those in the couch from your last 'innovative storage idea.'
Hey, every spoon has its place. But okay, Rach, you have yourself a deal. To Central Perk we go!
Oh my god, Rach, look at this photo. Is that a tub just sitting out on the street like that? There are even stains on it!
Ew, Monica, why are we even looking at this? It's like, totally gross.
I'm just trying to imagine the story here. Who would leave a bathtub in the middle of a city sidewalk? And all those laundry bags packed in the van, it's like a weird mix of bath time and moving day.
Maybe it's a statement, you know? Like art or something. Remember Phoebe's artwork? This could be someone's "Gladys" or "Glynnis".
If it's art, it's definitely abstract. And there's no way they were cleaning that tub properly if they just dumped it outside. If I was there, I'd be organizing a neighborhood cleanup within minutes!
You would totally rock that, Mon. And hey, at least there's a wooden pallet there too – it's like an outdoorsy, rustic bathing experience gone city chic!
City chic? Rachel, I swear, you could sell ice to Eskimos with your spin on things. But imagine if Joey saw this. He'd probably turn it into his next DIY project.
Ha! Joey with power tools? The last time he tried to build something, we ended up with what he called a 'book looking shelf'. It didn't even look like a shelf.

Right?! I mean, I love Joey, but I think we'd need to keep a close eye on him. Anyway, I'd never let something like this sit on my street. I'm just...it gives me the heebie-jeebies just looking at it!

Well, Mon, why don't we just flip this into something positive? Like, imagine we're walking by, and we see this scene but then, surprise! It's just part of a scavenger hunt or a movie set or something?
A scavenger hunt? Okay, now that does sound fun. I could totally see us running around the city, finding clues, and winning first place. Because, you know, I'd make sure we win.
Of course, you would. And you’d probably clean up half the city while you're at it. Moving vans with laundry and street-side bathtubs included.
Look Rach, this girl is playing tennis. You know, the molecular vibrations on the strings create an auditory frequency much like the purring of a cat, only less comforting and more... thwacky.
Yeah, I see, Pheebs, but I'm pretty sure tennis is more about the game than vibrating strings. Do you think maybe, um, she’s one of those people who actually understands the scoring system?
Totally. It's so confusing, right? Zero is love, which is sad because love should not be zero. Love should be, like, infinity or at least a number you can count on your fingers.
I know! Every time someone says "love-fifteen," I just wanna give them a hug and maybe some money to cheer them up.
We should do that! Or better yet, write a song about it! "Love-fifteen, not as keen, tennis, oh why are you so mean?"
Ha! Pheebs, please save that for Central Perk! You know, maybe she's training for something important. Hmm, the point is to hit the ball back and forth, right? Without hitting the net...
Exactly! The net is like this sneaky little hurdle. It's there, pretending to be all innocent, but it's actually the ultimate saboteur. Regina Phalange would never fall for such trickery.
Regina Phalange, the Olympian tennis player? Is that who we're going with?
Why not? She's also an astronaut and speaks eight languages. Including... tennis.
Only you, Phoebe, could invent a language out of a sport.
Well, every time the racket whacks the ball it's like it's saying something. Maybe it's an S.O.S. or "send more tennis balls"... Oh, or "Phoebe, you're our only hope!"
"Help us, Phoebe-Wan Kenobi, you're our only hope." Listen, how about we actually take some tennis lessons? Then we could actually understand what's happening in the picture. And wear cute outfits!
Rach, you just want to wear the cute skirt and visor, don't you?
You caught me. But, admit it, you'd rock a tennis skirt, too.
You betcha! And I would bedazzle my tennis racket to outshine all the competition! It would be like, "Love, Set, Bling!"
Okay, it's settled then. Tennis, here we come! And yeah, "Love, Set, Bling" could be our team name!
Rach, check this out! This lady's hair is like... super long. Kinda reminds me of Rapunzel. You ever think about letting your hair grow this long?

Joey, my hair appointment is like a sacred ritual, and you know I could never handle that much hair. Plus, I would probably spend all day trying to get gum out of it! Can you even imagine how many hair products she must go through?
Probably as much as you do in a month, right? Haha! But seriously, you think she uses that hair as like, a blanket or somethin'? Because that would be kinda cool.
I doubt it, Joey. Although that would save on the heating bill! Could you imagine trying to blow-dry that though? I mean, it'd take an eternity!
Yeah! And think about all the different styles she could do. She could have like a braid on Monday, a ponytail on Tuesday... Hey, maybe on Wednesday, she just goes full-on Cousin Itt.

Cousin Itt? Joey, she is a woman, not an Addams Family character. Although, you're not totally wrong about trying different styles. But dining out would be a nightmare! "Excuse me, waiter, there's a hair in my pasta... Oh, never mind, it's mine."
Speaking of pasta, imagine she gets hungry, and there's no food around. She could totally use that hair to catch a pizza flying through the air!
You know, sometimes I really worry about how your mind works. But pizza? Really, Joey? Not everything is about food.

Alright, alright. I'm just sayin', with hair like that, the possibilities are endless! She could start a new trend. Or better yet, use it as a prop in an acting gig. I could see it now: 'The Woman With the Magical Hair' starring Joey Tribbiani.
And who would you play, Joey? The prince who climbs up the hair or the hair itself?
Hey! I could be a very convincing prince. 'How you doin', Rapunzel?' No? Well, for the record, if I played the hair, it'd be the most charming hair you ever did see.

Oh, I have no doubts about that, Joey. Now, could you imagine the conditioner commercials she could do? Her hair is literally her biggest asset! But OK, for real now, if she gets a split end, it's probably a disaster!
A split end disaster, huh? Maybe we should send her a care package with all your hair stuff. I mean, it seems only fair since we're having so much fun talking about her!
That's actually really sweet, Joey. But let's stick to caring for our own hair, shall we? Now can we please watch something that doesn't involve excessive hair or pizza references?
Sure thing, Rach. But if there's a show about excessive sandwiches, I call dibs on the remote!
Whoa, look at that! Could those horses BE any more... in a hurry? I mean, where's the fire, guys?
Chandler, they're statues. They're not actually going anywhere.
Well, obviously. But you have to admit, it's as if one of them just heard there's a sale on polo gear at Ralph Lauren.
Hah, Chandler, that's actually pretty good. If we were at a museum, I might just think you know a thing or two about art commentary!
I do. It's all about looking at something and saying what you see. Like, "Here we see the elusive cowboy in his natural habitat, the Whole Foods parking lot."
You're ridiculous. You know, it actually looks almost epic, doesn't it? Like a scene right out of a movie or something.
Absolutely, I'm getting a strong "gone with the wind but with more horsepower" vibe here. Frankly, my dear, I don't give a 'neigh'.
God, your puns are saddling me with regret for even starting this conversation.
Regret? Is that what's galloping behind you because it looks like you can't escape it?
Okay, that's enough horsing around, Bing. Let's get back to watching this movie; these statues aren't going to run off the screen.
You're right. But if they did, that would be some intense 3D action, wouldn't it?
Only if your sarcastic comments came with a volume control. Can you imagine?
Touché, Rachel. Let's hit the pause button on my comedy career and see what these folks on screen are up to—besides not being as still as those majestic statues.
Check this out, Rach! Look at that amazing sunset over the river. It's like the sky is putting on its very own food presentation. It's just—ugh, perfect!
Wow. Mon, that is gorgeous. It's like... yum, I'd marry that sky and have its sunset babies.

Oh my God, look at the motorcycle! Chandler would so pretend he'd want one, but you know he'd be too scared to even touch it. He'd say something like, "Can you imagine me on that thing? I'd rather wear Joey's meatball sub as a hat."

Totally. And Joey would probably let him stay behind just to keep the sub safe! You know what though, I can picture you on that bike, Monica. Racing down the street, getting to a dinner party on time.
Oh please, I'd organize a bike parade where everyone has to ride at the same speed and follow a strict route. Heck, I'd even make them clean their wheels before they start!
And I bet you'd still manage to make it fun. Oh! Can you imagine if we took a trip to Paris? Just you and me, some French bread, that sun setting over the Seine.
That would be amazing, like that time we went for Ross's wedding, only less... British? And this time, NO going to the wrong airport!
Come on, Mon, that was one time! But yes, count me in for Paris—no airports, no bridesmaids dresses, just us and lots of croissants.
Rachel Green, you're a genius. We could do a whole culinary tour! The pastries, the cheeses—Oh! I could make a schedule!
A schedule? Honey, the only thing we need to schedule is our naps! We are in Paris, we are doing it my way: pure Parisian relaxation.
Alright, alright, but I'm planning at least one day. You know I can't help it. And you love it.
I do, I do. You know, this could be our 'thing.' Forget about backpacking and hostels. We'll be the fancy ones with an itinerary and matching luggage.
Yes! Oh, Rach, it's gonna be just like the trips we planned in college. Except, you know, we'll actually go on this one.
Exactly! And no getting stood up by any college crushes this time.
Haha, that's a low bar, Rachel, but I promise, we’ll clear it with room to spare.
Could this pizza BE any more appealing? Seriously, Rach, look at this. It's like my three favorite food groups: cheese, pepperoni, and whatever the third one is on a diet day.

I know, right? It's just so delicious-looking. If my dress weren't this tight, I'd dive right into that pepperoni. But do you see the one with the greens? That's the compromise pizza. It's like wearing a sweater that's also a bikini.
Compromise pizza, huh? That's like having a gym membership but only using the café. So, which one would you go for? Miss "I'm going to start dieting" every Monday?
Hey! That's harsh. But since you asked, I would totally go for the uncompromised, full-fat, I-don't-care-about-bikinis pepperoni. What about you, Mr. "I'll Just Eat Carrots at Work"?

Well, I am drawn to the pepperoni like Joey is drawn to a mirror. But, y'know, I've been trying to eat healthier because Monica keeps... um, encouraging me. So, I guess I'd try a slice of the "healthy one" while secretly eyeing the pepperoni like it's my high school crush.
Monica's encouragement, is it? That's one way to put it. Still, I bet you five bucks you'd cave and eat the pepperoni the moment Monica looks away.

Hah, Rachel, you don't get it. When Monica 'encourages' you, there's just no caving. It's like living with a very pretty drill sergeant. But okay, you're on! But if I win, you're giving me a tutorial on how to walk in high heels. It's crucial for my next office party.
Deal! Although seeing you in high heels is something I can't miss. I should have charged admission for that.
Just prepare to be dazzled. And if I lose, which is likely, I might have to borrow a pair of yours. And don't worry about the size, I have surprisingly dainty feet.
Okay, Cinderella, let's not get ahead of ourselves. May the best pizza eater win!
Oh look, Rach, isn't this scene just so raw and real? Like, there's no glossy New York filter here.
Yeah, Phoebe, it's very... um, different from what we're used to. But there's something kind of beautiful about it, in an unvarnished way.
Exactly! These people, they're just living their lives, without any fancy coffee shops or designer shoes. It’s all so unfiltered and free.
I guess there's a certain charm to the simplicity. It's just so hard for me to imagine living without, you know, the basics. Like, a blow dryer or a decent cappuccino.

I bet they have wonders of the world we can't even fathom. Like, maybe they can talk to the trees or the trains. That little kid there probably knows the secret to eternal happiness. And it's not a pair of Gucci boots.
Phoebe, you always have such a unique way of looking at things. Meanwhile, I'm focusing on how those kids are playing so close to those tracks! It's making me kind of nervous.
You know, back in the days when I lived on the street, I would've joined them. Life's not always about playing it safe, like wearing a helmet when you cycle or using cooking mitts.
Well, can you blame me for liking safety? And cleanliness? And, you know, not getting run over by a train?
No, I get it. But remember when you stopped being a shoe and became a purse? Sometimes, seeing things like this is like being a hat, Rachel.
Only you, Pheebs, could turn the entire world into a wardrobe analogy. But, I love you for it. Should we show the photo to the others?
Yes! I’ll tell them about the train-talking people, and you can worry about the non-designer dirt on their faces. It’ll be educational!
As long as Joey doesn't think the kids can literally talk to trains, we should be okay. Let’s make it a learning moment about... cultural diversity?
Sure, diversity. And I’ll prepare a song: "Ode to the Train-Talking People." It'll be a hit!
Hey Rach, look at this! This picture—it’s like the photographer was trying to capture the quintessential elements of a vegan diet. All healthy and green, minus the avocado pit, of course.
Oh wow, yeah, that’s definitely very... leafy. But, Ross, why is there dish soap next to the food? I mean, I like my salad clean, but this is taking it to another level.
Huh, that's true. I didn’t even notice that. Maybe it's suggesting that eating fresh produce is just as important as keeping them bacteria-free? You know, for health reasons.
Oh please, Ross, it's probably just there because someone was about to clean up and forgot to put it away. But you have to make it about science, don’t you?
Well, all I’m saying is that cleanliness is next to—hey, isn’t that spinach? Remember the spinach quiche you tried to make that one time?
"Tried" to make? Excuse me, I'll have you know that quiche was delicious—okay, it was a disaster, but in my defense, the recipe was really complicated!
I recall it being more like a spinach... pancake. Maybe next time we can cook together? I could help with the...flipping.

Cooking with you? Now that would be complicated. I mean, I love you, but you and I in the kitchen, with knives and a hot stove? We could barely make it through a pottery class without causing a scene.
The pottery class... That was one competitive afternoon, huh? But you're probably right. Maybe it’s safer for the both of us to avoid cooking together. We’d end up on another break!
Don't start with the "we were on a break" thing, okay? We are not going down that road again, especially not over a salad.
Alright, alright, no "break" talk. How about I just make us reservations instead? Y’know, somewhere with impeccable presentation minus the dish soap.
Now that sounds like a plan! Just promise me there won't be any surprises like... I don't know, you saying another girl's name or something?
Rach, I've learned my lesson. The only name I'll be saying is yours. Maybe we can even toast to a new kind of salad—one that doesn't end up looking like a Picasso painting.
Deal. But Picasso or not, you’re still buying the wine, Geller.
It’s a date, Green.
Well, would you look at that? Could that BE any more of a perfect skiing pose?
I know, right? She's like, all smiley and confident... I bet she's not even falling down inside.
And those sunglasses, they scream 'I'm so cool, I make snowmen shiver'.
Haha, Chandler, only you could come up with something like that. But hey, look at that guy in the back. He looks a little less... sure of himself.
Yeah. He's giving off a vibe of 'I used to be on a break, but now I'm on a slope and I have no idea which is scarier'.
Seriously! He could use some lessons. Maybe from "Monica Geller's School of Overcompetitive Skiing." She'd have that arm flailing under control in seconds.
Can you imagine Joey out there? He wouldn’t need a ski lift; he could just slide down on his charm.
For sure. And we both know he'd be flirting with the ski patrol instead of paying attention to the trails.
True. And I can already picture Ross, coming up with paleontological explanations for why he can't ski straight. "You see, due to the Ice Age, my center of gravity is much like the Woolly Mammoth..."
Absolutely! And not to mention Phoebe, she’d probably befriend a family of yetis by the end of the day.
So, how about you, Rachel? Ready to hit the slopes and show us how it's done fashionista style?
Well, you know me, I could rock a ski outfit. But actually skiing... that could be a runway show no one's ready for. How about you, Mr. Bing?
I'll be sipping hot chocolate at the lodge. I only like to experience near-death experiences metaphorically.
Smart choice. By the way, did you see that cute ski instructor by the lift?

And there she goes, if that ski instructor knew what's good for him, he'd zip right over here. But hey, I'm married, and my flirting days are officially over ski lift... I mean, over. See what I did there?
Chandler, never change.
Hey Rach, check this out. What do you make of this setup?
Oh... my God, what is that? Is that a shower head next to the toilet?
It's actually a bidet spray, used for cleaning... you know, after. They're quite common in Europe and parts of Asia.
Huh. Europe always has to be fancy, huh? But wait, that looks like it could be a recipe for a wet disaster for someone who doesn't know what they're doing.
Okay, see, it's all about control and technique. Basically, the opposite of when Joey tried to make that flambé dessert that one time.
Oh no, please, let's not revisit that... The kitchen has finally recovered.
Anyway, it's quite hygienic and sustainable. Saves on toilet paper. Think of it as evolution in bathroom habits.
Sustainable, sure. Imagine explaining the "evolution in bathroom habits" to Joey. He still thinks the dishwasher is a miracle machine.
I could probably design a little experiment: 'The Effects of Introducing Bidets to the Reluctant American Male'.
Honey, add that to your list of things we never, ever speak of at parties, okay? Especially after your whole "We are all descended from apes" opener.
Noted. But come on, you have to admit, the precision required to use one of these could be seen as... somewhat of a skill.
A skill, Ross? What would you call it, "target practice"? First lesson: Don't get your shoes wet.
Exactly, and considering my impeccable aim from playing basketball—
Basketball? Ross, please, the only thing you aim is the remote, and even then, we've lost three to the couch.
You may laugh, but I'll have you know, my hand-eye coordination is top-notch. And speaking of aiming, maybe we should get one for the apartment, you know, for science.
Please. The only experiment I'll be conducting is how long it takes for that thing to flood our bathroom.
Look at this guy. He's all like, "I'm thinking deep thoughts, maybe about quantum physics or like, what's gonna be the next big thing in sandwiches."

My God, Phoebe, you're hilarious. He does look serious, doesn't he? Like maybe he's considering how to finally get out of that friend zone with that girl from the coffee shop he always talks to but never actually asks out.
Totally! He's like, "Should I ask her about her aura or just offer her some of my latte?" You know, Rach, solids and liquids can be very seductive.
Ugh, solids maybe, but not liquids. Remember that time Ross tried to flirt with that girl by spilling his drink on her? Disaster!
Yeah, but in Ross's defense, she was wearing a very absorbent outfit. So, maybe our laptop guy here is contemplating the complexities of dry-clean-only fabrics.
I think you might be right. And look at those snacks in the back, is that a jar of pickles? I mean, who studies or works next to a gigantic jar of pickles?
Mystic beings like myself, Rachel. Pickles have this crunch that resonates with the cosmos. Every bite is like a star being born. Also, good for sandwich contemplation breaks.

Right, Phoebs, the cosmos. And I was just thinking about how delicious they'd be on a sandwich. Maybe I need to get in touch with my cosmic side more often. And hey, maybe this guy is a sandwich visionary, we could be witnessing genius.

Definitely. I can sense it. He's the chosen one, the sandwich whisperer. I should write a song about him. Imagine, "Oh sandwich man, with your pickles so near, whisper your breaded secrets into my ear."
Aha, Phoebe, please do. And make sure there's a verse about his soulful hat and scarf ensemble. He's like a modern-day Sandwich Picasso, but with more headwear.
You got it. I'll name it after you, too. "The Ballad of Rachel and the Sandwich Picasso." It'll be a hit at Central Perk!
Whoa! Look at this! That's a real classic, huh? I bet that engine sounds like a beast!
Joey, you know about old cars?
Rach, I may not know my way around a salad bar, but cars? C'mon! Plus, it looks like something straight out of those old movies I'd audition for and never get.
Well, at least you'd look good standing next to it, you know, in a leather jacket, with the whole bad-boy vibe.
I see what this is—you're picturing me as the tough guy, with the wind in my hair, huh?
Absolutely, but let's not forget about the wind messing up your hair. You'd hate that.
Hey, good point! But I like it, what's not to like? Classic car, good. Leather jacket, good. Joey's hair, always good!
Oh Joey, never change. But really, this car... it's got a charm to it, doesn't it?
Yeah, it's kinda like me—old-fashioned and charming. How you doin', old-time car?
Joey, please tell me you did not just use your line on a car.
What? It's a classic! The line, I mean. The car too, but y'know.
Well, if the car could talk, I bet it would tell you it's doing just fine, especially since it's getting all of this attention from us.
True! Now, if only I could get auditions for roles that cool. "Joey Tribbiani, star of stage and street!"
Don't worry, Joey. I'm sure there's a movie out there somewhere about a charming, sandwich-loving guy and his classic car.
Man! Imagine that—me, cruising down the street, sandwich in hand, solving crimes!
Solving crimes with a sandwich? Really?
Why not? I'd watch that show. "Detective Tribbiani and the Case of the Missing Meatball Sub!"
Only you, Joey. Only you.
Okay, now remind me again why we're not using the new leather sofa for movie night? I mean, could these cats BE any more sprawled out on my work reports?

Come on, they look adorable, Chandler! And you know if we move them, they're just going to give us those sad kitty eyes. By the way, have you seen my red sweater anywhere? I swear I just had it a second ago...
Let me guess, the last time you saw it, you were probably sitting right at this desk, and then the 'feline desk assistants' showed up?
You know, that's probably exactly what happened. Ugh, those two are worse than Ross when it comes to taking up space. And that's saying something.
Speaking of Ross, I think we just found his new defense for paleontology lectures—project images of cats, and bam, his audience is captivated. Plus, they might actually stay awake.
Ha! That's actually not a bad idea. But you know he's going to take you seriously and actually try it, right?

I know, and when it actually works, he'll never let me live it down. 'Hey Chandler, remember when your sarcastic comment about cats saved my career?' And then I'll be the cat whisperer guy instead of the 'funny one.'
Well, I'd take 'cat whisperer' over 'hopeless and awkward and desperate for love' any day.
Ouch... Could you BE any more of a straight shooter? But I guess that's fair, since you're now 'independent woman turns to cat lady.' How the tables have turned, huh?
Don't even start, Mr. 'I'm allergic to being in the same room as a chick and a duck.' Now, what are we doing about these adorable little report warmers, huh?
Well, only one thing to do. We'll have to watch the movie on the floor like peasants and wait until the royalty decides to grace us with permission to use my desk.
Sounds like a plan. Hey, grab some popcorn, will you? And if you can find where they hid my sweater, you'll be my hero.
Great, another title. Chandler Bing: Cat whisperer, report hostage negotiator, and lost-clothing detective. Could my résumé BE any weirder?
Welcome to our lives, Bing.
Oh my goddess, Rach, look at this! Isn't this the cutest thing you've ever seen? It reminds me of myself and Ursula, except less... you know, Ursula-y.
Pheebs, that is so sweet! You know, it kind of makes me think of Emma and how I want her to have a sibling one day. Minus the hair-pulling and the screaming, of course.

Yeah, well, as someone who's lived through the twin experience, I have to say, it’s not all sunshine and rainbows. But look at these munchkins! The way the older one is touching the baby's face—it’s like he's saying, "Hello little alien creature, I will teach you the ways of the earth."

That or he's trying to figure out if the baby's face is squishy. You know how kids are, Phoebe, they’re all about the sensory experience. But you're right, there's something just so pure about the way they're interacting.

Absolutely! It's like they're communicating on a higher level. No need for words—just love. Or, you know, possibly telepathy. If that baby's anything like me, he's already reading his big brother's mind.
Yeah, telepathic babies! Central Perk could definitely use one of those as a draw. Can you imagine? "Come for the coffee, stay for the baby mind-reading!"
I could totally write a song about that. It would be a hit, like "Smelly Cat" level of fame. Or at least enough to get me some free muffins.
Pheebs, that's because everything you do is just so... Phoebe. You've got that special Phoebe Buffay charm.
Awww, thanks. You’re like the super fashionable non-twin sister I never had. And, you know, not like Ursula who sold my birthright for a song.

Anything for you, Pheebs. But speaking of fashion, doesn't that little guy's outfit remind you of something Joey would wear? I mean, look at him, he's got that whole casual yet slightly disheveled chic thing going on.
Oh, you're so right! Little fashionista in training! But seriously, this picture should be in like, a baby magazine or something. It screams 'Phoebe's Guide to Brotherly Love.'
That's so you, Phoebe. Let's just hope the next photo isn't a baby version of 'The One with All the Kicking and Screaming'.
Even if it is, that’s just the circle of life. One minute you're all cute and cuddly, the next you're giving someone a judo flip. It's nature's way.
Look at this, Rach! Isn't this baby absolutely adorable? Trying to type like it's got the most important email to send!
Ross, it is cute! And look at those tiny hands on the keyboard, it's like our Emma when she tries to grab my necklace, only this little one's going after a computer.
You know, it's fascinating from a developmental perspective. This baby is showing early interest in technology, and who knows, we might be looking at a future tech genius here!
I just can’t get over that giggle, though. It could be the next viral baby video. Could you imagine if Emma became a little internet sensation?
Well, knowing us, Rachel, she'd probably become famous for her dinosaur knowledge first... and then her fashion sense, thanks to her mom.
Ha! That would be something. Pulling off a paleontological dig in high heels. Though, I’m not sure the museum floors could handle it.
True, but I can just see it now... "Emma Geller-Green: The Chic Paleontologist." She'd change the face of science conferences forever.
For sure, they wouldn't know what hit them. She'd walk in with her little lab coat and designer boots, dazzling all the other paleontologists with both her brilliance and style.
And, I can't help but think, with her energy, she could power this laptop without even needing a battery, just like this baby seems like it's trying to do!
Speaking of energy, we should probably harness some of Emma's for when we're up late with her. You know, taking turns to see who can make the most convincing dinosaur noises to get her to sleep.
"Convicing dinosaur noises", Rachel? There is nothing 'convincing' about your velociraptor impression!
Hey! My velociraptor is not that bad. And besides, at least I don't make the T-rex sound like it's asking a question... Roar?
Fair enough. But for the record, my T-rex is thoughtful and inquisitive, thank you very much.
Would you look at that, Rach? That truck's making quite the statement, don't you think? "Showtime" – it's like it's demanding attention wherever it goes.
Totally, Mon. It's hard to miss a truck like that, especially with that big bold writing. It's almost as loud as one of Phoebe's songs.
I know, right? Remember that one time we tried to move my couch up the stairs and how we could have used a truck like that? "Pivot! Pivot!"

Ugh, how could I forget? You shouting "Pivot!" is permanently etched in my brain. But honestly, a truck like that would've saved us from the whole couch debacle. Although, knowing us, we probably would have found a way to get the truck stuck on a corner or something.

Hey, I still maintain that my couch command skills were not the problem. But speaking of getting stuck, have you ever imagined what it's like driving one of these? I bet it's tough navigating through the city.
Oh no doubt. I can barely handle driving my dad's car in the city. But imagine parallel parking that beast. I'd rather try to convince Ross that we were, in fact, on a break.

Ha, good luck with that! Ross and breaks - a never-ending saga. But you know, with my organizational skills and your eye for fashion, we could totally rock the truck's interior. Make it, you know, "Monica clean" and "Rachel chic."
Mon? No one's gonna see the inside of the truck but the driver. And besides, can you imagine me, in heels, climbing in there? Not exactly a picture of grace and elegance.

True, but you'd make it work. You always do. Plus, who's to say we couldn't give that driver the ride of his life with an interior design makeover? They say home is where the heart is, it doesn't matter if it's on wheels!

Home is where the heart is, huh? Well, my heart would probably be racing from trying to keep that giant thing from crashing into something. But hey, if you're driving and I'm decorating, we'd make a pretty great team. Monica and Rachel's mobile makeover service!
Now that's a business idea! But let's be real, I'd probably end up creating a detailed inventory of everything in the truck and alphabetizing it. I can't help it!
And you'd be amazing at it. Just as long as there's no "situation" with you behind the wheel like with the Porsche, remember?
Don't remind me. Okay, no driving large vehicles for Monica. Lesson learned. We’ll just stick to the makeover part.
Deal. As long as it doesn't involve beef in a trifle, I'm in.
Agreed, no food mishaps on our truck. Just fashion, flare, and maybe a couple of cushions that say "Showtime," huh?
Cushions I can do. And maybe some nice curtains – gotta make it cozy!
Oh my God, Rach, look at this! Are these not the cutest teddy bears you've ever seen?
Mon, they are adorable! The one in the middle is totally something I would have begged my dad for when I was a kid. It's giving me major nostalgia.
Right? And it says, "I could use a bear hug today." I mean, how can you not melt? It's like the bear is asking for a Monica clean level of hug.
Haha, nothing can withstand a Monica clean hug. They won't know what hit them! But wait, you think Chandler would mind if we got one for our apartment?
Please, I’ll just tell Chandler that every living room needs a bear-sonality boost. He won’t argue with that logic.
"Bear-sonality," oh my God, Mon, that’s so cheesy, it's actually genius.
I know! They'd look perfect on our guest bed. And—oh! Wouldn’t they be so cute in the twins' room?
Absolutely! You and Chandler can teach them the important life lesson of taking care of a bear before they're old enough for a puppy.
Haha, that's actually not a bad idea. And knowing me, I'd create a cleaning schedule for the bears too.
No doubt! And hey, if Emma ever sleeps over, you bet she’d love these.
It’s a deal then, we're getting them. One for the twins, one for decoration, and one for Emma when she comes over.
You’re amazing, Mon. Planning for every possible bear-hug emergency. That’s so you!
What can I say, Rach? I'm always the hostess.
Oh my God, Rach, look at this kitchen! It's driving me crazy just looking at it. How can anyone cook in that mess?
I know, Mon, it's like they've never even heard of you and your 'Monica clean'. But hey, remember the time we tried to cook Thanksgiving dinner, and everything that could go wrong actually did?
Don't remind me. That was chaos, but at least we organized the chaos. And why are all those bottles out? It’s like a game of find the countertop under the clutter.

Maybe it's their version of a party? You know like when we have game nights and stuff gets everywhere... Except we actually clean up afterward. Plus, you would never let so many dirty dishes pile up by the sink.
You're right; I wouldn't. And is that guy washing a pot while the cabinets are wide open? That's just an accident waiting to happen!
Relax, Mon. Maybe they're having fun? Besides, you have to admit it does have a bit of that cozy, chaotic vibe that you sometimes get in those little family-owned restaurants we like.
Cozy? Chaotic, yes, but definitely not cozy. And those restaurants have a system, Rachel. This just looks like they threw the rule book out the window!
Well, you know, not everyone operates with a Monica rule book. Hey, I bet you could whip that kitchen into shape in like, twenty minutes, tops.
Twenty minutes, ha! Give me fifteen, a pair of rubber gloves, and watch me go. Seven! Seven! Seven steps to organization!
There you go, that's the spirit! And then after it’s all "Monica Clean" we could totally host a dinner party there. You’d be the hostess, of course.
Hostess? More like the head chef, organizer and the miracle worker. Let’s just be glad that's not our kitchen, or I'd be having a field day right now.
Absolutely, mon ami. Or should I say, mon chef! Now, come on, let's go grab a coffee at Central Perk and leave this kitchen nightmare behind.
Look at this, Rach! There's something so peaceful about this sheep just standing there in the middle of a field. It's like it doesn't have a single worry in the world.
I know, right? And it's just there munching on the grass, probably thinking about sheep stuff, like what's the best kind of grass or... Oh I don't know, sweater designs.
Ha! Sweater designs. That's cute. But it’s also probably thinking about which patch of grass is the cleanest and best maintained, kind of like how I am with my apartment.
Totally! If you were a sheep, you’d be out there with a little sheep-sized broom, just sweeping away.
Don't tempt me. If I could, I would absolutely go out there and organize everything. You know, line up all the sheep by height or fluffiness.
And knowing you, Mon, you'd have them all marching in a perfectly straight line to some sort of... sheep-chore like a military drill team.

Well, someone has to bring order to the chaos. But seriously, look at that coat – it needs a good brushing. I bet under all that fluff there's a sleek, well-structured sheep just waiting to be revealed.
And what about that view, huh? Imagine waking up to that every morning instead of the sound of taxi horns and construction.
I know! It's so tranquil. And all that space – I could host the biggest Thanksgiving dinner ever! With a separate kids' table and enough room for... for a football game!
Picture this: Thanksgiving on a farm. We could invite everyone; Joey could deep-fry the turkey outside…
Yes! Outside. Far away from my kitchen so he can't set fire to anything else. But Rachel, can you imagine if the sheep got into the leftovers?
It would be like the one with the Thanksgiving sandwiches all over again – but with a fluffier audience!
Seven! Seven! Seven layers of consternation from me thinking about the mess. But I guess that's part of the charm, right? The unpredictability of it all.
Sounds like a new adventure to me. We could get out of the city for a change – you, me, the kids, and yes, even the sheep.
Maybe there’s a secret farm girl side of me just waiting to break free. First, I’ll conquer the kitchen, then the countryside!
Hey, I'd buy fresh produce from Chef Monica's farm in a heartbeat, especially if you make it "Monica Clean" out there in the pasture.
You know I would. Not just clean, Monica clean, even on a farm!
Look at that, Rach! Doesn't that make you think of, like, all the souls up there just zooming around in the sky?
Wow, yeah! It is pretty amazing when you think about it. Do you ever wonder if, like, there's someone up there going someplace they've never been before?
Yeah, like they're off on some grand adventure or maybe they're going to meet their long-lost twin, just like me and Ursula... except without the whole 'ignoring me' thing.
For sure, it's wild. Hey, remember the time when you thought my cat was your mom reincarnated?
Of course! Spirits can inhabit anything... planes included. Maybe that plane's got the spirit of a giant metal eagle, or even better... a pterodactyl!
A pterodactyl, Phoebe? Really?
Why not? It could be flying alongside its ancient dinosaur soulmates!
Honey, I don’t think Ross would agree with you on that one, but I do love how you see the world—so full of possibilities.
Exactly! Like what if right now, there's someone on that plane deciding to chase after their runaway bride moment, just like you did!
Gosh, that brings back memories. It was terrifying but the best decision I ever made. Maybe there is someone up there making a huge life change at this very moment.
Totally! And oh my goddess, what if they're flying to meet their real-life Prince Charming, and they realize, 'You're my lobster,' just when they're about to land?
Phoebe, that would be amazing. But remember, sometimes Prince Charming turns out to be more of a... 'we were on a break' kind of guy.
Yup, that's when you grab your guitar and write 'Smelly Cat: The Airplane Version.'
And I would be right there, front row, to hear it. You know, it wouldn't surprise me if one day you really do write a hit song about an airplane adventure.
You just wait, Rach. My next song could be 'Jet Engines & Jelly Beans.' It's about the highs and lows of flight... and candy.
I'll look forward to it, sweetie!
Whoa, Rach, check this out. Doesn't this room kinda remind you of my old place? You know, minus the cleanliness and everything.
Oh my God, Joey, it really does! Except, you know, you never had a... what is that, a bear sitting on your bed?
Yeah, but remember I had the duck! And the chick. Oh, and that dog statue! Man, I miss those little guys.
I can't believe you’re comparing a bear to the chick and the duck, Joey. And don't get me started on your 'ceramic' dog.
Hey, that dog was classy! Anyway, look at all the stuff piled up over there. Kinda makes me feel like I was a neat freak.
Well, I wouldn't go that far. Remember the time I cleaned the apartment and you couldn't find anything?
How could I forget? I almost had a heart attack thinking you threw away my sandwich!
"Joey doesn't share food!" That should be engraved on your tombstone.
Not a bad idea, Rach. And you know what else? Look at those shelves – they've got stuff animals and books, just like the entertainment unit Chandler and I built.
You mean the one that only had room for that huge TV and no actual books?
Exactly, prioritizing the essentials. But hey, speaking of books, doesn't that pile on the floor kinda look like you're organizing your Vogue collection again?
Oh wow, it does... except, Joey, those are actual books, not magazines.
Right. Books. But anyway, you gotta admit, this room's got character. It's cozy in its own... chaotic way.
