Yeah, it does have a certain charm. Just needs a little bit of Rachel Green magic to tidy it up.
And maybe some Joey Tribbiani charm to make it... well, more charming?
Oh, sure, we can go with that. Just keep your sandwich away from the bed.
Deal. But hey, if we were to tidy up, where would the bear sit?
Knowing you, Joey, it would probably end up at the kitchen table ready for a poker game.
You got me there, Rach. That bear better know how to bluff!
Whoa, look at this, Rach! So many bikes in one place; it's like a... bike parade!
Oh my gosh, Joey, that's not a parade. It looks like just a busy street with a lot of motorbikes. I think it could be somewhere in Asia; they use bikes a lot to get around.
Right, heh. Asia... Y'know, I've always wanted to visit. Imagine, we could be the king and queen of sandwiches there! I bet they've never had a meatball sub like mine.
I don't know about royalty, but we'd definitely stand out. Joey, you do know that they have completely different food there, right?
Sure, I know that! But food is food, right? I'm all about trying new things... as long as I can still have my pizza.
You and your pizza. But I promise you, if we ever go, you are definitely trying the local cuisine. And I’m not talking about the local Pizza Hut.
All right, all right, as long as you try it with me. Ooh, maybe they have, like, a duck pizza or somethin'.
Joey, you're incorrigible. But maybe if we're lucky, we can find a place that makes a "Joey special"—two pizzas combined into one!
Now you're talking! But hey, look at the traffic signal. That little guy is green, means go, over there too, huh? It's like we're not that different after all, Rach.
True, Joey. Traffic lights are universal. Hey, do you think you could ride a bike in that crowd without causing a ten-bike pile-up?
What? C'mon, I could totally handle it... as long as it's not a silent auction—those are tricky.
Silent auction? Oh Joey, never change.
Oh my god, Rach, look at this! This takes me back to when I almost went professional with baseball. Do you see that swing? That could've been me.
Ross, honey, I know you like to think you had a career in basketball, which is adorable, but baseball too?

Well, no, I mean not professionally in baseball but I did play a lot with Monica and the guys back in high school. You know, it was all about the technique. Like, look at the batter's stance, the angle of the bat — it's all physics, really.
Sure, sure. Physics. Ross, when you played ball, did the bat even reach the ball? Or was it more of a theoretical kind of physics?
Ha-ha. Very funny. You know, If I had pursued it, I could've been like... the Babe Ruth of paleontology.
The Babe Ruth of paleontology who is afraid of getting hit by the ball. It's just so cute how you have all these alternate life paths in your head.
Hey, it's not cute. It's...untapped potential. Besides, a fear of being hit by a fastball is very rational, which, you know, speaks to my sense of self-preservation.
Yes, your self-preservation. Is that what kicked in when you said my name at your wedding with Emily?
You just love bringing that up, don't you? But since we're on the topic, yes, preserving my heart for you, obviously.
Aww, and yet you still managed to get hit by the ball. Emotionally speaking.
Well, luckily, I had the best team to help me recover. I mean you, Mon, Chandler... even Joey, with his meatball subs.
True. Nothing heals a broken heart like Joey's subs. You know, maybe in another universe, you're up there swinging the bat and I'm in the stands, cheering you on.
I'd like that universe. But I'll take this one — where I'm with you, watching the game.
So in this universe, do you think they're on a break?
Ha! We are never letting that go, are we?
Never.
Oh my God, Rach, look at this! These people are painted like... what is that, performance art?
Oh wow, Phoebe, that's... definitely something. They’ve got the whole face paint thing going on. It's kind of like what we saw at that avant-garde show last month, remember?
Totally! But it’s like they’ve jumped out of a comic book and decided to play baseball. It's so whimsical and out there, like the universe is playing dress-up!

Yes! But, you know, with sports. It’s definitely not what you expect when you think of a baseball game. It’s kind of like when I tried to combine couture with loungewear, it’s unexpected... and kind of a mess. But a creative mess!
Don't even, your loungewear was visionary! And speaking of vision, do you think they can see the ball with that makeup on? Their eyes look like dark portals to another dimension.
Portals to another dimension, right. Although, knowing you, Pheebs, you probably believe they really can see into another dimension with that paint!
You betcha! And I bet in that dimension they don't even play baseball; they play ‘Soulball’, where you score points for good karma. Oh! And the bats are magic wands!
Only you would come up with something like that. Soulball with magic wands – oh, Phoebe, imagine trying to explain the rules of that game to Joey.
Ha! He would just be like, "Do the magic wands make sandwiches?" But hey, look at their outfits, doesn’t it remind you of... y'know, that superhero phase Ross went through?
Please. Don’t remind me. I had to kiss ‘Red Ross’ goodnight for a week after he got that comic book deal. But actually, these guys might just be Ross’s type of league.
Right? And they could use my "Smelly Cat" as their team anthem! They can be the ‘Smelly Cats’! It’s perfect because, you know, sports people are all about those team songs.
Oh my God, can you imagine? A whole stadium of people meowing along to "Smelly Cat". That’s... I would pay money to see that.
Me too! And you know what, I think their face paint would just be the cherry on top. It's art, Rach – this is art that hits home runs!
Look at those giraffes! They're so graceful and tall... You know, they remind me of that song I'm writing, "The Elegance of Giraffe Necks." It's a work in progress.

Pheebs, that's so sweet. You know, I never really thought of giraffes as elegant, but now that you mention it, I can totally see it. They kind of have that natural high-fashion look, like they should be in Vogue or something.
Yes, exactly! And you know, giraffes only need to sleep like, 30 minutes a day. They're the ultimate party animals. If I were reincarnated, I think I'd want to come back as a giraffe.
That is so... you, Phoebe. Hey, do you think that giraffe looks like it's giving the other one a kiss? Or maybe it's telling a secret.
Definitely a secret. Like, "Hey, did you know that humans think we're high fashion now?" And then the other one is like, "I've always known, darling. Our time to shine has finally come!"
Ha! Can you imagine if giraffes became the next big thing in the fashion world? Maybe I should pitch a new line of giraffe-inspired clothing to my boss!
That would be amazing! You could call it "Green by Rachel... Giraffe edition!"
Okay, maybe not the name, but it's a start. Oh, Pheebs, I just love sitting here and looking at pictures with you. It's so relaxing... even with the wild giraffe fashion ideas.
Me too. And who knows, Rach? Maybe one day giraffes will walk the runway, and we'll remember this moment as the start of it all.
Could they BE any more mismatched? I mean, one's got a tennis racket, and the other's geared up for baseball.
I know, right? It's like they couldn't decide which sports camp to send them to, so they went for... all of them?
The memories. This takes me back to the time I tried to play baseball. I swung the bat, missed the ball, and accidentally released the bat into the stands. Some say it's still flying to this day.
Chandler, I highly doubt that bat is still in the air. But wow, sports were really not your thing, huh?
They definitely were not. If sarcasm were a sport, though, I’d be like, the sarcasm Olympian.
Ha! And I could totally see myself as the coach, not because I know anything about sarcasm, but because coaches get to wear tracksuits and blow whistles.
So, what you're saying is, your love for fashion doesn't extend to the whistle-wearing-sporty-spice realm?
Exactly! Although, I could totally revamp the typical coach's outfit. Make it stylish yet functional—Oooh! I could start a whole new trend!
'Rachel Green's Chic Coach Collection.' Now, that I would pay good money to see!

Funny, Chandler! But seriously, how adorable are these kids just trying their best at sports? It reminds me of the time my dad tried to teach me tennis. I spent more time hitting the air than the ball!
The infamous air-tennis technique. I hear it’s great for building... absolutely nothing.
Come on. They're just kids. Maybe one of them will grow up to be a great baseball player or a tennis star. Or maybe, if they're lucky, they'll avoid sports altogether and stick to fashion!
Or, in my case, stick to making sarcastic comments in a well-air-conditioned room. That’s where the magic happens.
Oh my God, Rachel, look at this picture! Is it really hot there, or is that guy just like, super passionate about frisbee?
Wow, yeah, he looks incredibly into it. And look at his friend's face, he's like, "Chill out, dude, it's just a game."
Uh-huh, or maybe it's not just a game for him. Maybe, he's from a long line of frisbee champions, and he's carrying the legacy of his great-great-grandfrisbeeman.
Pheebs, I don't think "grandfrisbeeman" is a thing. But hey, I can see it: 'The Frisbee: A Buffay Family Tradition'. It's kinda catchy.
Right? And notice their shirts are matching. Maybe they're playing for the 'Red Whirlwind' team. You know, that is not unlike my band's name 'The Red Swirl'.
That's if your band had more than one member.
Ha. Ha. Very funny. Ooh, and maybe they're not just playing frisbee, maybe they're using it to communicate with aliens. Like, each throw sends a message to the mothership. "We are ready for pickup."

That would explain the intensity. Or they accidentally joined a really extreme frisbee league and they're just figuring it out. "Extreme Frisbee – If You Can't Stand The Heat, Stay Away From The UFO."
Yeah, and if you get their frisbee wrong, they take you instead of the frisbee!
Oh, definitely not signing up for their team then – although it might be one way to finally get away from my credit card bills.
Totally, I’ll join you. We'll play frisbee all day and live off cosmic energy. But seriously, do you think the guy running just saw a cute dog across the field?
Probably. You know if that were the case, you’d be running much faster than him, Pheebs!
You bet! Dogs are my people. Well, you know, if I wasn't already Regina Phalange, queen of the humans.
Look at that guy trying to hit the tennis ball. He's all like, "Oh no, Mr. Ball, please don't hurt me!"
Phoebe, he's not scared, he's concentrating! That's what people do when they're playing sports seriously.

You know, he kinda reminds me of when Monica plays ping-pong. All intense and focused, but instead of a bat, he has like a giant spoon. It's funny, though, 'cause the ball has no idea what's going on. It's just flying through the air, free as a bird, and then smack! It's an airborne tragedy.
I would pay good money to see Monica play tennis with a giant spoon. But you're right about the ball, it's got a mind of its own until, well, smacked with the giant spoon!
And the way he's lunging, it's so dramatic. It’s like, "Here I come, ball! Prepare to meet your destiny at the hands of my spoon-racket!"
A spoon-racket! Oh my god, can you imagine trying to serve with that? I swear, sometimes the things you say, I can just picture them and it cracks me up.
I’m telling you, Rachel, there's a song in there. Maybe something like, "Spoon-racket, you're my sport. Hitting tennis balls like they're your last resort."
You should perform that at Central Perk! Maybe you’ll start a whole new trend in tennis equipment. Spoon-rackets by Phalange!
Brilliant! Then, I can have my own line of sports equipment, and for every spoon-racket sold, a tree gets planted. It'll be sports gear with a conscience.
Phoebe, I think you just created an empire. And I'll be the first in line to buy a Phalange Spoon-Racket... but only if it comes in pink.
Definitely pink, with sparkles! And every time you hit the ball, it makes a 'meow' sound like Smelly Cat is cheering you on.
"Smelly Cat, Smelly Ball," now why do I feel like this could really catch on at Central Perk? You would give Serena Williams a run for her money!
Now, all I need is someone who knows how to play tennis to team up with. What do you say, Rachel? Want to make sports history?
Honey, the only sports history I'd make is for the fastest exit off the court. But I'll be your number one fan, cheering you and your 'meow' on from the sidelines!
Whoa, Rach, look at this kid with the sheep. He reminds me of the time I played Little Bo Peep in that off-off Broadway show!
Oh my God, Joey, I remember you telling me about that. You had to wear that ridiculous costume with—what was it, tights?
Yeah! And I had this staff thingy that kept getting stuck in the curtains. Ha, good times. But look at the little fella, he's probably thinking, "How you doin'?" to them sheep.
Joey, somehow, I don't think that's what he's thinking. He looks more like he's trying to figure out how to get them to play with him, which is actually pretty cute.
You're probably right. He's too young for my killer line anyway. Look how he's squinting though; that's concentration. Bet he's planning some kind of sheep rescue mission.
You think? I bet he's just daydreaming about being a shepherd or something simpler. You know, normal kid stuff.

Or maybe he's like, "If I bring a sheep inside, can I keep it?" He's brave, I'll give him that. If that was me at his age, I would've been trying to figure out how to get them to share their food with me! Ha!
Joey, not everything is about food. But yeah, given your track record with not sharing food, I can see you plotting for sheep snacks.
Hey, I've grown... a little. But speaking of food, those sheep are making me think of lamb chops. I wonder if that kid realizes the connection there.
Joey! That's terrible. Don't ruin this adorable moment with your... your "meat sweats" perspective.
Alright, alright, I'll keep it cute for ya, Rach. But no promises if we go to a petting zoo and there's a food stand, okay?
Deal, as long as you don't start any conversations with "I like it. What's not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Good." around the kids!
You got it. Now, you think this kid here's got a future in herding? I mean, I could teach him a thing or two about stage presence with animals.
Oh definitely, Joey. Between his potential herding skills and your stage presence, he'll be Broadway's next big shepherd sensation!
Now, that’s a show I'd love to see! And maybe afterwards, we grab some pizza, just to stay on theme with the whole... Italy, sheep, you know.
Sure, Joey, pizza after watching a broadway shepherd show. Because that's totally the logical next step.
Look at that cute little place! It has a cozy vibe, like the kind of place you'd find a secret map or a hidden treasure.
You're so funny, Phoebe. Yeah, it does look cozy. Kind of like Central Perk but maybe with less... I don't know, less Gunther?
Mm-hmm. No offense to Gunther, but this place could use some of my music. Imagine 'Smelly Cat' amongst those flowers.
Sure! They'd love 'Smelly Cat'. And the flowers might actually help with the... you know, the smell.
Ha! Very funny, Rach. Do you see the menu? I bet they have all sorts of teas that could tell us our futures. Or pasts! Or other people's futures!
Phoebe, I don't think menus predict the future. But maybe they have that muffin you like, you know, the one with the thing on top.
The cranberry crunch? That would be amazing. Remember when you ate the last one, and I wrote a song about betrayal?
How could I forget? You sang it for a week straight. Let's go in! And I promise, Phoebs, this time, if there's a cranberry crunch muffin, it's all yours.
You're the best. Ooh, we should totally sit by the window. You know, for the natural light and to keep an eye out for any... you know, bunnies or something.
Bunnies? In the city?
Rachel, you never know where life's wonder will hop from!

Oh look at this cat, Rach! It's sitting in the window like it's waiting for someone to arrive -- like it's anticipating the return of a long-lost love from the wild frontier. You know, in Ancient Egypt, cats were worshipped as gods.

I know that, Ross. And they have not forgotten this. Look at that face, that's the face of a creature that knows it's royalty. Actually, it kind of reminds me of my mom's cat—remember, the one that hated you?
Hated me? Could we not say intensely disliked? Although, I have to admit, it does seem to have that disapproving look Mrs. Green gave me the first time I had dinner at your place.
Oh my God, yes, and that's the same look it gave you every single time after that. This cat could be her spirit animal.
Speaking of spirit animals, if you had to choose a spirit animal for me, what do you think it would be? And don't say dinosaur, that's too easy.
Hmm, that's tough. I would say maybe... a penguin? You know, because they're kind of awkward but still lovable, and they mate for life. It’s romantic and very you.
Penguins, huh? Well, I'll take lovable and romantic any day. So what would be your spirit animal?
That’s easy—a dolphin. They’re graceful, intelligent, and they always look like they’re smiling. Plus, they're always well-dressed.
Dolphins don't wear clothes, Rachel.
Yeah, Ross, but if they did, you know they would be stylish. They are the fashionistas of the sea world!
